channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ‘Imperial Israel’ in the New Middle East
item.description: Despite a cease-fire with Hezbollah, almost daily strikes demonstrate an embolden Israel’s strategy to eliminate its enemies any time, anywhere.

item.title: Democrats Say F.B.I. Is Investigating Them, and U.S. Plans Gaza Compounds
item.description: Plus, some piping hot Thanksgiving takes.

item.title: China’s robots—from ‘factory brains’ to vacuums that can pick up your socks—are lapping the competition
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: The future of treasury in 2026: A new tech mandate for finance leaders
item.description: Treasury professionals face a pivotal year of transformation.

item.title: A Major Moment for the British Economy: What to Watch in the U.K. Budget
item.description: Rachel Reeves, the top economic official in an increasingly unpopular government, will appear in Parliament to present tax and spending plans.

item.title: The Question Hanging Over Peace Talks: What Will Putin Accept?
item.description: A U.S. proposal may cross a number of red lines for the Russian leader, who sees little to lose and much to potentially gain from continuing to fight.

item.title: Scott Bessent wants the era of Fed-watching to end: They should ‘move back into the background’ and make fewer speeches, he says
item.description: The Fed didn't want to get embroiled in politics in 2025—or ever. But Bessent wants them even further out of the public eye.

item.title: What Warner Music’s settlement with Suno says about the AI bubble
item.description: Instead of rolling up their sleeves and preparing for a long slug fest, music labels are curiously keen to work with startups offering consumers tools...

item.title: Huge Fire Engulfs Apartment Buildings in Hong Kong
item.description: Firefighters tried to douse the blaze at an apartment complex in the city’s northern Tai Po district, which killed at least four people.

item.title: The 4 best ways to avoid getting sick while traveling, according to an Olympic doctor
item.description: Dr. Jonathan Finnoff has spent years researching how to prevent illness among globe-trotting athletes, which have yielded strategies any flier can use...

item.title: Huge Fire Engulfs Apartment Buildings in Hong Kong
item.description: Firefighters tried to douse the blaze at an apartment complex in the city’s northern Tai Po district, which killed at least four people.

item.title: The Question Hanging Over Peace Talks: What Will Putin Accept?
item.description: A U.S. proposal may cross a number of red lines for the Russian leader, who sees little to lose and much to potentially gain from continuing to fight.

item.title: ‘Imperial Israel’ in the New Middle East
item.description: Despite a cease-fire with Hezbollah, almost daily strikes demonstrate an embolden Israel’s strategy to eliminate its enemies any time, anywhere.

item.title: Deadly Flooding in Thailand Prompts Rescues and Evacuations
item.description: The military sent troops, helicopters and boats to rescue stranded people. At least 33 people have been killed and more than two million displaced ove...

item.title: Fire Engulfs High-Rise Buildings in Hong Kong
item.description: At least four people died after a blaze tore through high-rise apartment towers in Hong Kong on Wednesday, a government spokeswoman said.
